definition: to misplace/displacement (e.g. of broken bones)/out of alignment/faulty contact/erroneous judgment/inversion (medical, e.g. breach delivery)
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: This is a misplacement, an overlap of my childhood memories and the reality of today.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种错位，我童年的记忆和今天的现实的重叠。

sentences.english: Indeed, the emphasis on affordability might be slightly misplaced.
sentences.chinese: 确实，对可承受性的强调可能有些错位了。

sentences.english: Blurred minds and incorrect values would definitely lead to popularization of the bureaucratic working style.
sentences.chinese: 头脑不清，价值观错位，必然会导致官风盛行。

sentences.english: Wrong positions of control destroyed profit distribution system balance.
sentences.chinese: 管制错位使原本均衡的利益分配机制失去平衡。

sentences.english: Fourth kinds of dislocation, dislocation is their" natural person".
sentences.chinese: 第一种是把自己错位成“民意代表”。

sentences.english: The weakening of the motivation and guidance function also causes the value mismatch.
sentences.chinese: 特级教师制度的激励和导向功能淡化也导致价值错位。

sentences.english: He says the problems of an aging population represent only a mismatching or misalignment of the demand for goods.
sentences.chinese: 他说，人口老龄化问题仅代表对商品需求的错位。

sentences.english: At the individual level, though, misplaced trust can get us into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 在个体水平，错位的信任就可能使我们陷入麻烦。

sentences.english: But in real life, such misplacement often occurs in people's thinking.
sentences.chinese: 但是在现实生活中，人们又常常出现这样的思维错位。

sentences.english: The internal hook malposition of universal horizontal metroscope influences surveying precision of internal size.
sentences.chinese: 万能测长仪内测钩错位影响内尺寸测量精度。

sentences.english: These dramatic changes have also produced severe economic and social dislocations.
sentences.chinese: 这些巨大的变革同样引发了严重的经济和社会错位。

sentences.english: Between the links, there appears to be disappearance and misplacement.
sentences.chinese: 各环节之间在人才培养方面存在缺失和错位。

sentences.english: Of course, that misplacement resulted in a stupid sentence completely void of logic ?
sentences.chinese: 当然，错位导致了一句愚蠢的，完全无效的逻辑？
其中有错位，有迷失方向，也有自我分裂。

sentences.english: Individuals with gender identity disorder have strong cross-gender identification.
sentences.chinese: 患有性别错位症的人有强烈的性别转换倾向。

sentences.english: This misallocation of resources results in lower productivity and reduced real wages.
sentences.chinese: 这种资源的错位将会导致生产率和实际工资的降低。

definition: deformation/to become deformed/to change shape/to morph
to overlap/to superimpose/to telescope/to run together/to duplicate/one over another/superposition/an overlap/redundancy/reduplication (in Chinese grammar, e.g. 散散步[san4 san4 bu4] to have a stroll)
(of uneven surfaces) to fit together/(of gear wheels) to mesh/(dentistry) occlusion/bite
to cut apart/to sever/to separate/to isolate
